reviewContent: Every time I arrive from international flights there is confusion, delays and closed sections to go from customs to connecting flights. On this occasion you had to exit the airport security after i rechecked bag then re entere to the terminal, I had duty free bottles of wine so i asked the bag check attendant and told since it's duty free it should be fine... not a chance had to check my back pack and hope it makes it without breaking. Also When Sky train has non functioning station there is a sign for it after you've gone all the way up to the station. I always try to avoid this airport for international entry.

Started with rude traffic officers when my husband was helping bring my 7 year old son across the street. The baggage check is confusing, signs don’t matter and there’s virtually walls of people and no one helping direct you. I was redirected to a different entrance 3 times, even though I was following the signs properly. TSA was rude. No bins for small items or your bags. After getting to the gate it was fine but going through back check and TSA was an intense nightmare. It’s fine for solo travel I guess but traveling through this airport with children was awful

TSA staff rude. Moved about without purpose or care - slowly with apathy. One rep on their phone. 2 security lines open. One line jammed up due to having to take a bag off line to check. Waited 15 minutes in the line. Said they were short staffed and didn’t have anyone to check the bag. When we moved over to the next line because the one we were in directed us to, the other rep yelled at us and said she had customers waiting before us. Are we not also her customers that were waiting? She then glared at us and was whispering to another rep about us. Condescending and rude to travelers. They were laughing at people trying to get through, including airline crew and airport staff for being frustrated. This causes anger and frustration and a poor overall mood for passengers when good and positive attitudes would support happy and positive travelers and less issues on airplanes. Embarrassed for this country with international travelers when other countries are kind and calm to travelers because they know it is important for commerce, mental health, and relations with other people. When we finally made it through there were 15 TSA staff standing just inside the concourse having a meeting. Gate staff were kind as well as the staff at the Juan Valdez coffee shop, otherwise would have given a zero.

Worst customs ever. Consistently crowded and confusing. Staff are condescending and rude. Facilities are dirty. The connecting flights lines were very disorganized and people were panicking had a 2 hour layover barely made it to my connection. Trash bins were overflowing in terminal D. No water stations. Very outdated.

commentHeader: keep a lot of time to complete security
reviewContent: Really sad airport, not clean, equipment breakdowns but keep a lot of time to complete security checks. They do not open multiple security check areas which basically means that up to 10 flights use the small security check areas. It took me 1.5 hours to clear this.

Shameful. A city with the international importance and financial opulence as Miami cannot have third world services and facilities like MIA. I used to like this airport but in the last year there has been a significant decline.
This place must be a joke. No, seriously, how is it even possible an airport like this one in a city like Miami? Worst experience ever. If you are flying to/from Miami please be careful.

What is wrong with the people running this airport? Dirty, no decent restaurants at least on concourse G. Minimal electrical outlets. Bus had to take us to two separate sides to unload the bus. When was this airport built?

commentHeader: What a joke of an airport
reviewContent: Dirty airport. Surly retail people. There was a fight that broke out and I told 2 workers to get police and they couldn’t understand English. What a joke of an airport.

Such a messy place. It’s a very crowded place with not enough staff. Due to air traffic my flight got delayed from the departure city. At the arrival due to the same issue it took us awhile to get off the plane. Once out we had to walk miles to get to the passport control area where we found hundreds of people waiting in line. Many of us having a connection flight and there were only a few agents working so because of this a lot of us were late for the connection flight. After this the check point took even longer to get through and once again not enough staff was there working. Also I had to pick up my luggage and drop it for the connection flight something I never had to do with any other airline. We traveled with American Airlines (not recommended) after getting through all of this we had to walk miles again to get to our gate which was at the very end of the hallway only to let us know that we had lost our flight and there was nothing to do other than placing us at a standby list and hope for the best only because it wasn’t the airline fault. According to the American airlines agent this had to do with the controllers and the air traffic so they wouldn’t offer us a hotel room or food just because this was the airport fault. We ended up spending a whole night there where we couldn’t even get a bag of chips because they got rid of vending machines so they have no food options passed 11 pm. Honestly a pretty bad experience. I’ve been to plenty of airports and they’re never this disorganized. Miami you need to step up!

commentHeader: lowest on my list of airports
reviewContent: I flew in and out of Miami airport twice in Mar 2024. What a zoo! Uber did not find us, Hotel taxi drove past us twice. Getting to the car rental area was long and then waited forever for a car to be taken off campus. This airport is lowest on my list of airports.

I amazes me as European how Americans think everything they have is the best in the world, when it comes to first impressions of a country its main airports fly the flag as to what to expect once you are there. Sadly Miami airport has to be one of the worst organized airports in the world, everything takes forever, the staff are miserable, no one could care less, the facilities / shopping / dining consists of basic third world stuff, the place is grubby, half the elevators don’t work. Place is a dump. Thought that DeSantis bloke was supposed to be good, judging by Miami airport he’s a dunce. Airport looks and feels like everyone has given up. Won’t be flying back through here again, don’t care if it costs more to go through somewhere else, this place just ruins the start or finish of any joinery.

commentHeader: baggage claim was a hell of disorder
reviewContent: Coming into Miami from abroad to connect to a flight in the US none of the walkways worked from Terminal D to passport control nor the Skywalk. the baggage claim was a hell of disorder. Then to go through to-our connection we had to go through security again//really! And the line was unbelievably long, the TSA staff did not give clear instructions about what to put in the bins, bags that had already successfully gone through inspection were shunted off for detailed inspection, which lasted 15minutes. Then we had to walk all the way back through Terminal D to its far end to get to our gate. This is a failure of the Airport Administration.

Worst airport experience in decades. Broken skytrain, walkways, escalators and elevators. Unhelpful and rude staff. Forced to walk miles and wait in lines for hours. Almost missed a connecting flight in the same terminal (D) with 3 hours time. We did not have time to use the restroom, sit down, eat or drink a thing. 3 hours were spent running, hauling bags and waiting in long lines. Staff is rude and goes out of their way to not help you. My 3 year old got hurt and was bleeding from the mouth due to the hazards in this airport and staff not only refused helping her but laughed and talked about how she had fallen in Spanish (which I understand and speak!) . Golf carts meant to replace the sky train do not help even those with children or disabilities (they seem to only help other staff members and chat in their cell). They also broke my bag, however I didn’t have time to file a claim due to the terrible experience. Avoid this airport at all costs!

Our flight was at 7am and Enterprise only opens at 5am. When we finally got everything sorted out it was 5:20 and the elevator as well as the escalators didn’t work so my husband had to carry 4 luggage items up 4 flights of stairs. Then the moving escalator to the train also didn’t work. When we got to the terminal the escalator to the ticket counter didn’t work. The security line wait time was 25mins. Overall terrible experience.

If you're a fan of inefficiency and a dash of the cold shoulder,  venturing into MIA is like stepping into a time machine, and not the cool, futuristic kind. It's more akin to a leap backwards into an era where charm and functionality are myths, and cramped, outdated spaces are the harsh reality.  The staff ability to maintain an aura of indifference in the face of any question or plea for help is truly commendable. It's as if they've taken the concept of 'the cold shoulder' and elevated it to an art form. Navigating the airport is akin to participating in an escape room you never signed up for. The layout is so cramped and convoluted. It’s clear the design was inspired by a labyrinth, with a dash of "let's see how many people we can confuse before noon." Calling it 'old and dated' is a kindness. It's as if the airport is stuck in a bygone era, stubbornly refusing to join us in the 21st century. The charm of yesteryear has certainly overstayed its welcome here. But the pièce de résistance has to be the TSA security clearance - a spectacle so inefficient and embarrassing, it deserves its own reality TV show. The TSA staff, not wanting to be outdone by their airport colleagues, take rudeness to new heights, skirting the line of abusiveness with a finesse that would make a drill sergeant blush. It's a process so fraught with frustration, you'd think it was designed as a test of human endurance. In an era where digital connectivity is akin to oxygen, MIA somehow manages to turn free WiFi into a luxury item. Thanks to the generosity of American Express, passengers can access the internet, provided they have the patience to sit through ads. It's a charming reminder of the dial-up era, a nostalgic throwback that no one asked for. The concept of passenger experience seems to be an alien one at MIA. From the lack of food outlets to the scarcity of lounges, it's as if they're pioneering a new minimalist approach to airport amenities - less is more, and in the case of MIA, much less. In conclusion, if you're seeking an airport experience that combines the charm of a Soviet-era bus station with the efficiency of a sloth, look no further than Miami International Airport. It's an adventure you won't forget, no matter how hard you try. I wholeheartedly advise anyone to avoid this horrible, dingy, old, awful airport at all costs. It's truly a masterclass in how not to run an airport.
Over 2 hours in immigration line. Miami Airport is a disorganized mess and no one seems to care. Non citizens line must have been 3 or 4 hours judging by the lines. Disgraceful.

Avoid this airport whenever possible. We have travelled over 10 times and going through Miami on an international flight is by far going to be your worst experience. Do not go through with a short connection. They are unorganized and mismanaged. For such a busy airport you would think they had a great system. Send your management to Japan or any other US airport to see how to do it. Hire someone that wants to improve.

My experience at this airport was terrible. I was connecting through Miami in a flight to Barcelona (Spain). The connection was quite short (90 mins) due to an earlier delay in the first flight. The lines for passport control were massive, I have never seen anything like it, so I asked the staff if there was a priority line for connections and emphasised my short connection. After a bit of confusion and me having done most of the regular line, eventually someone came and handed us the orange cards and we went into a separate queue. The short connection queue was still quite long, so I requested one of the staff if he could organise it prioritising those with flights leaving earliest, like my own. I was understandably quite nervous about missing my flight, as I was travelling with my mother, a senior with a disability. The gentleman said he couldn’t do anything and that I had to wait, I insisted that the system was making little sense but was in no way disrespectful. Another passenger was allowed to go to the front of the queue however, which I thought was unfair particularly to me as I was the one with the earliest flight. I also can’t understand as a key international hub there isn’t any organisation whatsoever to connecting flights

Miami Airport is a disgrace to Florida. Filthy areas with rubbish left everywhere and disorganized staff! The immigration and security staff were extremely rude to everyone lining up. I would not recommend this airport ever again as this airport needs to seriously improve. Seeing an airport looking filthy, no carpets, and disgraceful staff is absolutely disappointing and it seriously needs to improve if it wants to step into competing with different airports! Disgraceful place and avoid at all costs!

This is the worst airport I’ve ever been. The security check is extremely slow and the staff are very rude. It took us about an hour to go through the security checkpoint and we missed our flight. We have to stay an extra day at Miami and we missed our family gathering for New Year’s Eve. The airport design is so poor, if you went to the gate A-D and you want to go to gate E or F, you have to come out completely and redo the security check. So if your gate is at E or F, you can’t enjoy the priority lounge which locates at gate D. The security staff asked us to check in our prepaid carryon luggage as she thinks it is bigger than the standard size although we measure the size at home and it fits the measurements of the allowed carryon according to the airline instructions. So combined with the worst airline the Frontier our vacation is ruined although Miami is a beautiful city, we don’t want to come back.

commentHeader: will never fly through here again
reviewContent: This airport shows no compassion or consideration for those citizens from around the world who arrive at its doors. A two hour wait in stifling heat, shuffling forwards to an area where just 6 booths were in operation to take account of the thousands of people arriving no water or seating provided. After dealing with COVID and all of its implications Miami has learnt nothing and appeared to move at a pace that was unable or unwilling to respond to the numbers amassing. I can honestly say that I will never fly through here again and I can only pass this information on to those yet to experience it.

Horrific. Does not acknowledge disabilities unless you have a wheelchair. My daughter has severe autism and we were told it doesn’t matter unless she was in a wheelchair. Next time we know to rent a wheelchair to get the help needed for a child with a disability. I don't know how they can completely ignore the Americans with disabilities act and still receive federal funding

commentHeader: I will avoid it at all costs
reviewContent: Our arriving plane had to sit on the tarmac for 25 to 30 minutes because there was no gate available. This made us late to our connecting flight, since the gate for that was about a mile away and this skytrain was broken, which I understand is as usual. I can’t walk that far and was so exhausted after clearing passport control, US customs, TSA, and then getting to the faraway gate. My American Airlines rep was not overly helpful or friendly either. The whole experience makes me never want to go there again. I will avoid it at all costs.

The arrival process is shambolic. It took us 90 minutes to get through immigration. The queuing is poorly organized to the extent that you have to queue to enter the main queue, but as nothing is organized, there are loads of people milling all over the place. The immigration officer, once we got to the front of the queue was pleasant and friendly enough, but looked as though she had seen enough for the day too. Oh and of course only about half the booths were manned. Remember that immigration is the first thing that visitors see when they arrive in the USA. It's almost as though the country was trying to discourage tourists from coming.

This is a horrible airport. The signage is difficult to find. The bathroom was dirty. You had to walk miles because the skytrain was broken. Based on earlier reviews this has been the case for a long time. Asked people for directions to rental cars and nobody was able to help. Information desk or better signs would be useful. Avoid this airport if you can and Uber/Lyft rather than renting a car which was a separate disaster.

I was disappointed with Miami airport on my departure on Oct 11, 2023, and then became even more disappointed upon my arrival on Oct. 18. The airports "SkyTrain" was not operational, and they had limited number of carts to help those in need. I am 73 years old but having to walk from baggage check-in (around gate 20) to gate 45 was not a pleasant experience. According to a friend, the Skytrain has been broken for about 6 months. I only witnessed two golf carts for seniors while walking about a half mile to my gate. Deplorable. To make matters worse, there was one section where the AC was broken. You think they would contract with a vendor to provide golf cart service above their normal service if the SkyTrain was out of order. My arrival was almost worse with a 1/2 to 3/4 mile walk with NO CARTS and NOT ONE OPERATIONAL PEOPLE MOVER (flat escalator). Try to avoid this airport at all costs, especially if you are elderly. They did have AED's. Now I know why.

This is the most mismanaged airport that I have encountered in over 500,000 miles of travel.  Poor signage (DFW successfully redid all of their signs a few years ago). We were directed in the wrong direction several times. Asking employees for directions was no help because they did not know where baggage claim 6 was either.  Poor maintenance - Most elevators were out of service, and had apparently been so for months or years, since the signs directing you to the next working elevators were ragged and worn.  Restrooms not serviced - no paper towels or air dryers. Transportation services not available - the train was not operable; the golf carts were sitting unused with no driver. This was in Terminal D which is almost a mile long. When we arrived on an international flight we had an extremely long walk to customs and there were no chairs in which to rest.  There were unreasonably long distances to walk to immigration and customs - sometimes the signs sent domestic and international passengers in different directions, only for them to join again. The signs indicating which line to get in were confusing - we saw dozens of people being moved from one line to another.  It was very difficult to find hotel shuttles, and they are located in a dark area across several roads from the terminal. The electrical outlets in our seats had no power.  The entire design of the airport appeared to be by an architect who specializes in corn mazes.

I was traveling through MIA last weekend and found so many problems. There is no-one at the information desks. and when i ask some employees for some help, they ignored me or gave me bad information. Where are the friendly volunteers like other airports? Why are so many elevators not working and/or dirty? Perhaps MIA should retrain their employees.

commentHeader: disappointed and embarrassed of our airport
reviewContent: I was born and raised in Miami Dade County and so disappointed and embarrassed of our airport. Restrooms need maintenance, the acoustics throughout are poor and transportation is either non existent or impaired. My flight had a gate change at the last minute. The gates were about a football field apart. I hitched a ride on one of many wheel chairs, but got off soon as woman was suggesting she expected a tip. The security was unorganized, crowded. Management needs a good management system. It's done at other airports in Florida, successfully. The whole airport looks like it has patchwork construction and design, archaic layout. Wheelchairs and transport buses running where people walk! Gate signs don't make sense. I had to ask people where to find everything. Loud speaker sometimes can't be heard, sometimes loud. Terrible!! Where is our tax payer money going. It's certainly not going to this place. Governor DeSantis needs to overhaul the management. Tampa has a beautiful airport, comfortable, organized and beautiful restrooms. Jacksonville too...What the heck is going on in Miami??

commentHeader: have more regard for the elderly
reviewContent: This is a plea for Miami and all other international airports to have more regard for the elderly at the airports. =I am 82 and walk much slower than before and standing in the one spot is a struggle. I arrived somewhere in Miami Terminal E after a horrid BA flight, walked for 20 minutes to the Immigration Area where I waited an hour before my turn came and then I walked some 30 minutes to a lounge at D 30 and then had to take a small train to the gate. I do not mind the walking if there are the electric walking lanes that are working but the standing in lines is a strain. - I have occasionally used a wheelchair but these are often promised but do not arrive. My other problem was going through security at Miami where I was told to keep my shoes on although I have artificial knees but then the person at the screening told me to take them off which is more difficult than the young may imagine.

Our originating flight from Miami to Belize was 3 hours late. When arriving in Miami the customs line was a mile long - no exaggeration - I have video and photo. There were maybe a handful of officers to handle customs and thousands of passengers. We missed our connection. From standing in line for 2 hours. Then after getting baggage another line to leave so add another hour because 1 man was letting people out. Then a line of 550 feet to get vouchers from American Airlines. We did not wait because was already 10:30pm. No employees here to assist thousands of people. Same experience this morning. Stood in two huge lines to check in and get through security due to few employees working. Now we arrive at our gate, and not even half enough seats to sit in to wait. Meanwhile, remodeling is furiously happening. Perhaps Miami airport should hire people to work rather than remodel right now. Complete inept and terrible customer service.

An absolutely disgusting airport! The most uncomfortable airport with lack of services that are found in most other airports in the U.S. Had an overnight stay, a loud buzzer sounded every 3 seconds from midnight to now 5.40 am, escalators going down operated but those going up were not functioning. The sky train was not operating for hours preventing me from being able to go to purchase water. This is not the only occasion that this has happened, it's just a poorly run airport!

Poor signage, everything was broken. Elevators, moving sidewalks, bathrooms were filthy, not enough charging and if you find a wall plug your plug literally falls out of outlet. Overall a dirty airport. Forget going to a gate if you are looking for selection of restaurants.

Miami airport is the most disgusting airport I’ve ever been in. The once-blue carpets are black in most places and appear to have never been washed. Littered with food and trash everywhere - and the bathrooms are as back as a filthy run down gas station. I’m looking around as I write this and literary every service is filthy - the floor, the seats, the columns holding up the ceiling. Not just dusty, not just some loose rubbish - truly filthy. Avoid at all costs.

commentHeader: beneath those of many third world nations
reviewContent: I clear customs and collected my bag. I exited customs only to discover that the sign saying, Checked Baggage, abruptly ended as I found myself unsure where to bring my bag in the middle of the airport. I asked the single officer on duty. He had no idea. There was no there to assist passengers, only a pair of women behind a booth selling phone cards. The lack of signage or any personnel to guide passengers is shocking, and makes me think that Miami Airport has worse service (and security protocols) than airports in less developed nations. But I don’t think anyone in Miami or Florida gives a damn. Your standards are beneath those of many third world nations.

This airport is a joke! The worst airport I ever been! Who ever is the manager should be sacked straight away. 2.5h waiting in the longest line ever, 3 officers behind the desk not rushing at all. At some point was only two of them and amount of people waiting more and more. Another airport in US which is 100 years behind of any airport in Europe - shame on you!

I’m embarrassed for the U.S. that this airport is a “gateway” for so many people. My flight from Dallas Love Field arrived in the G Concourse which reminds me of the old New York LaGuardia terminal. Low ceilings, narrow walkways, dirty, dark, interior. I made my way to ground transportation which was a nightmare. The signage is confusing and with the proliferation of ride share apps like Uber, Lyft, etc., one would think there would be ample signage. The entire ground transportation area is confusing, with inadequate signage. Then, there are the airport staff. I had trouble getting a Lyft, and decided to take a cab. The cab driver told me that since I was going to Hilton Airport Blue Lagoon, I had to take a “blue” taxi. I asked an airport ground transportation worker for directions and he pointed and said, “at the end.” I never found the blue taxi and finally ended up waiting for my hotel’s courtesy van for another 30 minutes.  Upon arrival back to the airport for my departing flight, the same chaos ensued. I arrived at the airport at 8:00 a.m. for my 11:55 a.m. flight back to Dallas. Since I had time to spare, I went to the Star Alliance Lounge between H and J. Security checkpoint was horrible. Crowded, confusing, and I was in the line for the TSA Pre-Check which they were merging with the CLEAR and general security screening. Employees are brash, if not just downright rude. The walkway between H and J was much nicer; except for the restrooms. Wow - I think they imported these from old gas stations. Dark, dirty, in disrepair. I finally made my way to the Star Alliance Lounge. The entrance to the elevator from the concourse level is two double doors that made me think I was going into the back kitchen of an old diner. Followed, by a dirty elevator with taped signage directing me to the lounge. The walk from the elevator to the lounge entrance made me think I was in the wrong place, but I kept walking and eventually found it. Finally a nice escape from the worst airport I’ve ever experienced.

This airport is filthy. There is dust under the chairs, food, and trash all over the floor. There are very limited food choices and they automatically charge 18% gratuity. The guy was so rude and did not deserve a tip. If I ever have a choice in the future, I will not pass through this airport. Also, there is not enough seating at the gates. The charging station has 4 slots and you have to stand near it to charge your phone. So pathetic.

Dirty airport. I can see the dirt on the overhead pipes where I am waiting for the departure. I am tired to see the airport not cleaning and not keeping up. We don't have any other choice to use other airport to travel and this airport needs new management.

I only came across people who spoke Spanish, and they were constantly chit-chatting. It seems as though we are interrupting their conversation when we pose a question or offer advice. For the same reason, the customer support is nonexistent. The coffee served at the terminal is bitter, of poor quality, and overly priced for subpar coffee. At 7 a.m., the airport's tables were already dirty, and people were chit-chatting in their coffee shops rather than cleaning them. I assume that even though people work and are paid to help others, the interruption of their conversation to answer questions or offer advice causes them inconvenience. Our TSA cards and Global Entry cards don't seem to signify anything.

What a horrible experience! I have never seen an airport with no sit down restaurants, rude employees, and very limited accommodations to sit and wait for hours. Never again, I will fly into Fort Lauderdale next time I leave Miami on a cruise, this place is a dump - not a fan of much in Miami!

Nightmare! International arrival Passport/Customs takes forever, need to go to checkin again and TSA (without precheck available) idiotic. A woman in TSA line making smarmy comments about people’s luggage icing on the cake. Avoid this dump.

The logistics and operations of their international arrivals (customs and the baggage check and re-check) is a complete shambles and needs to be completely reconstructed, organized and properly staffed. When 2.5 hours is insufficient to ensure making your connecting flight something is wrong. We witnessed dozens of missed connections on 3/18 due mainly to the baggage carousel in the international arrivals terminal. A complete zoo. Several Inoperable escalators and moving walkways further complicated passenger movements. We recommend avoiding international transfers through Miami whenever possible.

commentHeader: This place needs a total revamp
reviewContent: This airport is a joke. Rude staff, zero directions, and disgusting upkeep. They promote reducing plastic bottles yet only provide unsanitary drinking fountains to refill your water bottle. Good luck finding facilities that are even remotely clean let alone any food that isn’t cooked beyond consumption or the price you could get a decent meal elsewhere for. Security is a complete nightmare due to lack of communication, ticketing is so archaic you may as well have a punch style ticket. Save yourself the hassle and fly out of Ft. Lauderdale or Tampa. This place needs a total revamp from the ground up.

My recent experience connecting through MIA was absolutely atrocious. My wife and I flew into Miami from the Caribbean, where we were connecting to a flight back to our home in San Diego. Getting through Customs with our Global Entry status was a breeze. But then MIA put all connecting international passengers into one gigantic line to get through security. There was no TSA PreCheck. The line was agonizingly slow. When we finally cleared security, we had to sprint more than 30 gates to get to our connecting flight. We made it with just a few minutes to spare. When I later emailed a complaint into TSA, I received an automated response. I have never been to any other U.S. airport that didn't offer PreCheck. That a major airport like MIA doesn't offer the service is inexcusable. If you're connecting internationally, avoid this airport if you can.

Got off an American flight from Ecuador. First, none of the escalators were working so we all had to drag heavy baggage up a couple flights of stairs to get into immigration. Second, the sky tram was down, a long walk to immigration check in with heavy bags, no offered assistance. Then we are put in one line which isn't moving, so they shuffle us to the other end, more chaos, more time. I had to go through security 3x. First I waited in line to be told I had to check my roller bag. 2nd time in line my backpack goes thru the scanner, keeping in mind this is the 8th flight in 2 weeks with no previous issues, and TSA decides my $70 hiking sticks are an issue. Back to AA counter to check the sticks, no guarantees they'll make it, no guarantee they will replace them if lost. I was escorted by a TSA agent to the counter regarding my stick issue, still had to rerun everything a 3rd time their security. Next time I go to Ecuador I'll be connecting in Atlanta.

Our experience at Miami airport was dreadful from start to finish and I would recommend people to avoid using it if at all possible. All queues were ridiculous and so long that many people were extremely stressed and worried about missing connecting flights, as were we. Staff were often rude and unhelpful and the airport is confusing and very difficult to negotiate. I will try hard never to return. (I would have had a glass of wine to cheer myself up but it was far too expensive.)

commentHeader: 2 hours in line for passport review
reviewContent: Waiting almost 2 hours in line for passport review and almost missed our connection. There were only a few kiosks open and the line was over 8 rows deep and went outside of the room. Completely unacceptable. Will try to avoid this airport for a connection next time.

Surprised to say that this airport did not exceed expectations at all. Since stepping off the aircraft to bags being in baggage claim was roughly 45min-1 hour. Now I flew American Airlines, which actually never took my bag off the flight so my bags ended up being sent to Vegas. I know that the problem is more with American Airlines and not the airport, but when trying to get help on where to go and who to talk to I was met with great resistance. No one wanted to help and after spending over four hours trying to find where my bag was I eventually left and gave up. The workers in the airport were incompetent. I never once raised my voice or had an angry attitude towards a worker, because I know that it’s not their fault that my bags were lost. However, I waited in baggage claim line for 45min waiting to get an answer on where my bag was. When I got to the front, the associate refused to scan my baggage slip and told me to go look in a pile of bags I already looked through. After telling the associate I had already gone through all the bags with other associates she just waived her hand at me to leave. The airport layout is horrendous and it feels like a run down mall instead of an airport. Everything is dirty and the seat availability is absolutely slim. There is very little seating for people who have to wait for flights. Even on a day with little to no delays you find yourself either shoulder to shoulder with someone or sitting on the floor. On my departure trip back to the airport I arrived, come to find out instead of holding my bag they lost for me to recheck, they sent it on a flight back to Dallas after we had already discussed over the phone I would pick it up myself in Miami. I got to the airport at approximately 8:30am and my flight didn’t board until 3:00pm. Since I was coming from a cruise I didn’t have much option but to wait in the airport. Since I entered the terminal there was a loud alarm that stated “may we have your attention”, “the current alarm in being investigated by the fire department, please standby for more instructions.” This alarm continued to go off every minute even after I got on my flight to leave. I understand the safety of having alarms, but it sounded like it had been going off for days. Seating was again slim and the restrooms were absolutely disastrous. Overall, if you plan on spending anytime at all at an airport make sure it is not in Miami. For an international airport I am shocked at how horrendous the experience is. The service and associates around the airport treat people nothing more than a ticket. 1/10 I am never coming back to this airport, I would rather spend hundreds of more dollars than spend another minute here.

commentHeader: people like him is what we need
reviewContent: We arrive in a Avianca flight on the 9th January 2023 it was my mother, my sister and me, my sister knee was very bad and couldn't walk and a person by the name of Godfrey Glanville employee of DAS help us with a wheel chair, although he already had a person he wen lt above his call of duty to help me and my sister but the part about was that he was already pushing 2 wheel chairs and a bad when my mother who is 83 years old started to feel without a breath so he stop and went to get a 3rd wheelchair so now he was pushing 3 wheel chairs plus the bags, I will call him a life saver and a super hero, people like him is what we need and he should be in a management position as he understands the needs of other people and he knows how to create solutions and not excuse.

commentHeader: could be the worst in the country
reviewContent: Miami Airport could be the worst in the country. Today Jan 9, 2023, around 500 people (and the line kept getting longer) were in line at the US citizens passport control an only TWO agents were working. Absolutely insane. I had a connecting flight and security check was a madhouse on top of that the TSA agent with whom I dealt yelled and yelled at people. I asked her not to yell and she yelled back at me. And she kept yelling. Disgustingly unprofessional behavior. This airport’s service has gone from bad to worse.

I live in Florida and this airport is horrendous. Slow and incompetent workers. Everything is in slow motion here. Baggage takes forever. They don’t honor priority access or baggage. Fort Lauderdale is better but Miami sucks relative to all airports nationwide.

commentHeader: chaos referred to as the Miami Airport
reviewContent: There is no possible way to accurately describe the chaos referred to as the Miami Airport. If one is an international flier arriving at this airport, the chaos begins with trying to secure luggage. People running into each other in a tiny pedestrian lane occupied by persons entering and exiting the baggage area. No accurate signage for direction, just a few employees in yellow vests waving their arms. Next is the reloading of baggage prior to entering Immigration then TSA. Because of a recent knee replacement, I was relegated to the scanner line. Little movement of the line due to a break down of the ONE machine. We were directed to the metal detector whereby the agent just waved us through (the machine beeped, but was flag through anyway). Next was our quest to find Terminal E (gate 30). Signage was confusing. Nobody to direct. Found a flight attendant who directed us to a Skytrain, it could not adequately explain where to go next. A stroke of luck took us to the gate. We were in the last boarding group which was being called as we approached the gate. We have traveled to some second tiered countries that are better equipped to handle passengers in an organized manner. This is no way to run an airport. One that I will avoid at all costs.
Horrible airport. Probably the only country in the world where you have to pay for a baggage cart. $28 for a glass of wine. Unfriendly staff. Avoid it like the plague!

commentHeader: a real shame for this country
reviewContent: Miami International Airport, specifically the area of arrivals, is a real shame for this country; my country! First of all, the cleaning of the areas once the passenger disembark from the airplane there were even water leaks from the roof with plastic containers to collect the falling water. The conveyors to help passengers walk to the passport control area did not work. Once the passenger gets into the immigration area, there were just a few positions active so the lines were incredibly long; we, my wife and I, wasted a least one hour after a long journey of ten. And we were on the US Citizens line; I cannot imagine the waiting time for foreign visitors. This is not the quality level that we can expect from the most avance country over the world! This is not the image we should be exposing to our visitors. Besides, we, the Citizens, deserve a better treatment!

commentHeader: two and a half hours getting through security
reviewContent: We left Cancun and had a layover in Miami. When we arrived at the Miami airport, we were required to go through the U.S. Customs and Border Protection process since we were reentering the U.S. The line was very long and there was no sense of urgency by the staff to help customers. Despite having many booths to help folks, there was just four employees manning them, and all but one employee worked at a very slow pace. After spending an hour in the Customs line we then proceeded to get our luggage. No staff member explained that we needed to pick up our luggage and take it to another location. Once we figured out what needed to be done we then proceeded to security. Once we arrived there, the line was crazy long and it took over an hour to get through that line. The staff there also worked at a very slow pace. We spent over two and a half hours getting through security and customs which caused us to miss our connecting flight. There were many people in line with us who also complained about poor customer service, slow service, and lack of coordination by the staff. In fact, a lot of other people missed their connecting flights as a result of this disaster. I hope I never had to visit the Miami airport again.

Gate D7. Everything is so dirty. The Seats, the carpets, the restrooms, restaurant floors, the carpets have dark stains all over and everything smells horrible. Our TSA welcome very early in the morning was an employee with a very bad attitude and demeanor. Very dissatisfied.

commentHeader: one of the worst airports in the US
reviewContent: This is one of the worst airports in the US. The transit gateway from entering and passing through customs is the worst. Not only are TSA agents rude and unprofessional, the layout of the airport is terrible. I have had stuff stolen here from me when I put it down, as well as having to run from one side of the airport to the other sprinting to catch the next flight. The airport is super rundown and I don’t know how American Airlines is using this as their hub to South America. I have global entry and the transit from checkin a bag in to go through domestic is a joke. Then the line to the transit from Internstional to domestic takes 30 minutes. It’s better to just exit and re-enter through. This could have saved me 30 minutes. The food selection is terrible and there isn’t much else appealing but I’m going to South America for work and leisure so this is the worst part of my journey.

Miami airport is hands-down the very worst airport in the country. It’s unconscionable that they make you walk over 3/4 of a mile ( Measured it on an exercise app) to get from your arrival gate to passport control. Long long Corredor‘s 75% without any people mover walkways, and of the few people Movers at least half were broken and non-functioning. Then after passport control it’s almost another 3/4 of a mile to get your baggage recheck it and get to your connection gate. Senior citizens and kids, everybody has to walk this far. It was exactly the same thing last time I came through Miami last August. Hands-down the very worst airport in the country! Whoever managers this airport should be fired immediately for incompetence!

Return flight with BA to T5 Heathrow. Dropped off the Hire Car at the spookily quiet car rental centre (car sat nav and then good signage made it easy from the I95), and got the shuttle train to the relatively quiet Terminal. Easy to find the BA check in desks, queues not too bad and after 15 minutes we went through Security. Found the American Airlines Flagship Lounge (near Gate D 30) and checked in with a glass of champagne. Sat doiwn to find that my wife had left her cell phone at security in one of the plastic trays. A half hour search back at the security gate, and with the help of security staff and a fellow passenger and thankfully she found it. A big Thank you to those staff and the passenger - one relieved wife. Don't know whether this is a trend but we have found Miami International has improved over the years - far, far better than it was, say, 15 years ago. Would, on this basis, recommend.

A very disorganized airport. Wait until you read this! We arrived from Madrid into their international terminal. We had a connecting flight to our final destination. Our bags were checked from Madrid through to our final destination. Customs worked smoothly with Global Entry. Then we needed to pick up our luggage before we could drop baggage off for our final destination. It took 50 minutes for our bags to come. We then had to take our bags into the Main Terminal to the American Check in location. Needless to say, we along with many other people missed their connecting flight. Just saying, most international airports have a system in place where you put your bags on the conveyer belt after going through customs. I have never had to go get in line again in the main terminal. Please avoid Miami, I would say its a step below Atlanta.

commentHeader: not have asked for 3 nicer people to meet
reviewContent: My boyfriend and I had a very stressful experience losing 2 phones at this airport until TSA agent Lilliam (liliana) Rodriguez saved the day by finding our phone and tracking us down to help return it just before departing on our connecting flight. For hours we ran around the airport begging for help and were turned around in different directions by many employees that didn’t want to take the time to deal with it. We are so grateful for Miss Rodriguez’s kindness so that we didn’t miss our connecting flight! Also, another kind woman at lost and found on the 4th floor, whose name I did not catch, was very helpful and giving of her time. There was also a very nice tall man who worked near terminal D25 that was so incredibly kind and offered to walk the airport until we met Rodriguez. I could not have asked for 3 nicer people to meet today. Thank you all for being understanding human beings and helping turn our chaotic day around to make it a little better.
Avoid this place like a category 5 is coming straight for Miami. They are the most unorganized, nonchalant, and unprofessional people I’ve seen working in an airport.

Customer service is non existent compared to other airports. They have many information desks...but no-one is there at night or weekends. The elevators and moving walkways are broken. Some employees don't even speak English. What kind of message is Miami trying to send? Management is only interested in money...how much money they can make. They are not spending it on the people who make that airport a money maker. And when you complain, all you get is how much they try...but management does not support the front line employees. We have traveled to 5 different airports this year and every one of them show support to us when we have a question or problem. We will travel the extra 45 minutes to Ft Lauderdale where they care about passengers.

I had a horrible experience at Miami Airport. We are a military family. My husband and I are traveling with an infant. I tried to check in on the Spirit app and they only provided me with my husband’s boarding pass. It said I had to go to special assist at the airport to get mine and the baby’s boarding pass. We arrived an hour and 45 mins before our flight. We were dropped off at the departure gate for Spirit but the check in was all the way on the other side of the airport on a lower level. We checked our stroller and car seat with our bag. We then had to walk back to the gate where the TSA line said 15 mins. The line of people did not reflect the estimated time. We tried to go through the tsa pre check line but the representative would only speak to me in Spanish and we were ignored by many. We also told many airport staff that we aren’t going to make it on our flight. No one cared. The tsa line took 45 mins to get through. My husband ran to the gate because it was no where near the line and the gate was closed even though it was still 5 mins before departure. After running with an infant in my arms we missed our flight by 6 mins. We could not make it back to check in to request my child’s items because of how far away check in is from the gate. Now I’m stranded in the Miami airport and have no way to transport my infant.

commentHeader: staff at the bag scanner downright rude
reviewContent: The staff working at the bag scanner was just downright rude. Yelling at me to push up the trays without even giving me a chance to do so. The bags were so backed up it's not like there was a reason to rush. If I spoke to people at my work like that I would be fired.

I’ve always preferred FLL when traveling to visit family in Colombia because of streamlined customs process, but last summer in MIA, everything was good. Today it was unbelievably horrible. Right away, 2 out of 4 people movers were inoperative. Given the actual 1/2 mile to walk, this was not appropriate. Initial customs was not bad but then everyone was screened again! Usually they spot check but today, there was one PO’d girl checking passports and only one screening lane open. A guy was walking back and forth saying to put tablets and computers separate and shoes and belts off. The crowd was getting impatient when some young group cut the line. A supervisor was called out and they were sent back after some yelling and shouting. Finally another lane opened right as we were up front. Then as we were taking shoes and belts off the agent said “why are you pulling your computers out?” I had the regrettable audacity to inform him the the other agent was shouting those instructions to the crowd. That annoyed him so we stuffed the laptop and tablet back into their case and moved on to baggage claim and re-check.so why don’t they screen all bags again if all people are being scanned again after being in a contained environment? This was bizarre and chaotic at the very least and unprofessional at worst. Unless my life depends on it I will avoid MIA for the 2 years I have left before moving to Colombia.

commentHeader: Staff not very helpful or knowledgeable
reviewContent: Seating before check-in is ridiculous, if you are disabled you have to pay for a wheelchair so I sat on my suitcase or stood. Staff not very helpful or knowledgeable. If you have time before going through boarder control look around the shops as only 1 after going through customs. There is a small bar and the gent behind it was lovely. At the British Airways wait area there are usb ports but charge faster with the usa plug adaptor - nothing else apart from toilets and fending machines. Wifi may be free but be prepared to have to keep logging in.

commentHeader: Be prepared to walk a whole lot
reviewContent: Very unorganized, very little direction, no help, carpets dirty, walking escalators mostly broken. Very hard to find where you’re going in this airport and no workers to help with directions or information. Be prepared to walk a whole lot!

The waiting area is disgusting, the carpet was dirty. I asked several people with assistance finding someone to clean the waiting area and no one was able to help me. The cleaning staff told me they only clean it at night. I would never fly to or from Miami airport again.

commentHeader: the worst experience I've ever had
reviewContent: Save yourself the trouble and fly out of Ft. Lauderdale. This airport was the worst experience I've ever had in an airport. Had a 9pm flight and all of the food options were outside of TSA. One in the terminal all of the stores to purchase snacks closed at 8pm. So your stuck with no food options so eat before you go. The check in process is a joke. everything is so spread out. The rental car drop off is a few miles away and you have to board a tram to get to terminal.

Elevators from parking lot are disgusting, dirty trash cans and overflowing. Terminal D train glass doors and windows dirty. Elevators, electric escalators always broken all over airport. TSA employees clueless in how to direct customers and super rude to travelers. Bathrooms without hands free paper towels, out of order sinks, dirty & employees always on their phones or in the hallways talking.

commentHeader: super dirty and in very bad shape
reviewContent: We arrive in terminal for Turkish airlines on July 5 at 6:40 pm Terminal 4. The bathrooms are super dirty and in very bad shape! The terminal is all dirty and run down. It is amazing that an airport in USA looks this way! Just came from Turkey and what a difference! Shame on who ever is taking cate of this airport total embarrassment for our country.

One of the worst airport experiences of my life. Arrived 3.5 hours prior to our flight to drop off the hire car. The Car Rental Centre is a decent set up but a relatively long way from the airport. Lots of walking, escalators and a train to get to the check in area. Long lines at British Airways check in with only two agents working behind the six available desks. Bag drop took nearly two hours. TSA security wasn't as bad but still took 30 minutes. Briefly stopped at the small Duty Free shop before heading to the gate by which time our flight was already boarding. All in all a very tiresome experience which did not make me want to use Miami again.

No matter how many times I transit through, it's always something. This time, more of the same with the lines for customs being ridiculously long, but that's normal for them. I also wanted some transport info as I has a long stopover, and walked to 3 different information counters. Not one of them was manned by any staff member! All were automated with a button to call. I called repeatedly but it rang and rang with no answer. Ok, I finally figured it out on my own after a bunch of time wasted, and took the airport tram to the public transport area. Again, no one was behind the information booth. I honestly don't think the people in charge care much for customer service. Extremely poor customer service and extremely poor logistics with this sorry excuse for an airport.

Probably the worst airport experience in the United States. Infrastructure relatively new, but seems that the architect was on holiday and facilities were haphazardly put together. It took us over an hour to get to car rental counters - after walking about a mile and taking two trains! We had to walk half a mile to take train to claim our luggage, then walked another half a mile to take Miami mover train to car rental terminal! What a disastrous airport planning!

commentHeader: I have never seen anything so frustrating and demeaning in a US airport
reviewContent: Very inefficient process, apparently justified by the 100% sniffed by dog policy at the D gate checkpoint. People queue up for this farce to go 2 at a time with a random stranger, and instructed to "walk at the exactly then same pace." Then the dog is led into the swirl of air created by those two, plus everyone else crammed around them. The people are then herded into a line of 5 credential booths, but if everyone doesn’t go all the way to the last one, they are yelled at for not listening and causing inefficiency. The closer 4 credential booths are then filled when the one further along overflows. I have never seen anything so frustrating and demeaning in a US airport.

One of the worst in the USA. If you are flying out of this airport (even in the earliest hours of the day or at night) prepare to waste a lot of time at security checkpoint. I spent 1.5hr on a TSA line because they had one TSA Officer checking identification. One? Are you kidding me? Finally they decided to open another scanner machine but then my flight door was closing. Of course I missed my flight and so did a few other people because of this. Very inefficient process. Also the airport is old and Miami desperately needs another one.

Chaotic, not well organized, unclean. Employees are seen standing around on their phones and blocking entrances. Food trash everywhere. Old interior, gross bathrooms. Good variety in the food and shops though. Nowhere near enough seats.

commentHeader: Duty Free stores were plentiful but all empty
reviewContent: Customs well organized but once you rechecked your luggage there was one TSA agent screening everyone that had a connection. The line was at least 40 minutes long. The Duty Free stores were plentiful but all empty. Once I encountered the extremely rude ladies in the store I understood. I can not understand how they expect business when they are haughty and disrespectful to all who cross the threshold. Horrible experience. High point was the Centurian lounge although it was very crowded.

commentHeader: Concourse J has limited food outlets
reviewContent: Terrible, Concourse J has limited food outlets with McDonald's closing at 18.56! Overpriced as no competition, make sure you bring your own food or eat before entering. Shameful considering the choice for concourse for internal flights!
Its freezing inside. A huge waste of energy. Poor layout causing huge walks. Unfriendly and unhelpful staff that treat customers poorly. Confusing signage posted.

The staff just stands back not even trying to get the luggage through security at a quicker pace. Got there 3 hrs and 37 min before for flight and after security I had 22 min to eat, restroom. People in line were saying they could not make it to there flights, even after waiting over an hour. The luggage needs to move through faster - come on, we can put people on the moon! Rude people here!

TSA was very organized even with the amount of people trying to get through. Fast, friendly and very pleased to see a K9 dog being used as 2x2 we all walked past. Good job Newark Airport needs your way.

This was the worst airport I've ever been in! Some background on me: I’m in a wheelchair & incapable of clear speech. I am used to the way I am treated rudely at airport security by not being helped for a while, but the Miami airport was really BAD! I sat FOREVER at security waiting to get patted down, & when someone finally came, she helped a girl who came WAY after me because she stopped the line (she was on a scooter with a broken leg & in the “normal people” line, instead of being off to the side, like me). The lady who came from security looked right at me & said nothing (like, “I’ll get to you in a minute”), & took the scooter, & closed the door! I was furious! Wished I could yell. They treated me so badly at security that by the time I left, I cried. To top it off, the airport was so cold I could barely move my fingers to sign or type to my husband about it! At first, I thought they were just rude to me, but apparently, my daughter was treated poorly too.

commentHeader: Staff has no clue what is going on
reviewContent: Rubbish change in Miami. Both ways. Huge lines, absolute no prioritisation over people who are late. No one around to talk to. No directions. Staff has no clue what is going on. Worst airport ever. We were late for connecting fight and immigrations created complete mess, mixing up people so that we got later than those behind us, with our flight 1 hour away. Everyone in the que irrespective if flight 5 min or 3 hours away. Don't use this airport.

commentHeader: The personnel are  poorly trained and rude
reviewContent: The worst experience by far. Wait time at the security checkpoint for J gates was insane. Only one agent processing all the people. At least 15 of us missed our flights and we were there with plenty of time! The personnel are  poorly trained and rude. (If you are rude to them, it’s a federal offence). They don’t care if you are going to miss your flight. It’s a disgrace. Something must be done! Miami it’s an important hub and it should really be up to standards.

commentHeader: American service is definitely not what it used to be
reviewContent: This is the worst airport I ever seen in my life. It took 1.5 hours to get through security. Only 2 TSA agent checking ID and 1 belt running, so disorganized, simply ignoring people. The airport employees are rude, just saying use your eyes to find a seat to put your shoes back on, seriously. American service is definitely not what it used to be. This airport is filthy - the departures lounges treated in such a bad way with rubbish such as food boxes and empty bottles left on seating, left on the floor - left everywhere, no garbage trash cans for it. With Covid 19 cleanliness should be a priority - here it is not, people in TSA line not even 6 fts apart. I've been flying for over 20 years, and never seen such a sad airport. I'm hoping someone, like a manager or CEO is actually reading all this bad reviews, and can change this for better way.

Worst airport in US. Poor signage. A long haul to the rental car center and no idea how far it is. Involves Skytrain and elevators and a lot of walking. The airport website not helpful in planning how to get there. Some waiting areas filthy and this is early morning. Food and grime on seats. One male restroom had only one toilet the rest all urinals. Grumpy American Airlines departure agent unhelpful. ID scanner malfunctioning

commentHeader: the worst airport I've ever been in
reviewContent: I've been flying solo since I was 7 so over 20 years. This is the worst airport I've ever been in. Staff were less than helpful, TSA was disorganized and simply ignoring people trying to go through the screening, and "valet" baggage check people were genuinely rude. Shout out to the guy at currency exchange for being helpful and friendly! He was a lone beacon of professionalism and general politeness. If I have to drive an extra 30 miles or so to go out of Ft. Lauderdale going forward, I will.

commentHeader: poorly trained and poorly supervised personnel
reviewContent: I'm glad I finally used Miami as my re-entry port on a return from Jamaica. It taught me a valuable lesson. Never, ever, use this airport for your international connections. They won't certify this review but all you have to do is look at all the previous reviews for the exact same issues weeks and months ago. Woefully understaffed, contract security couldn't even answer questions like. Which line is which and these appeared to be supervisory personnel. They were so bad they couldn't keep the lines organized and there were no signs no directions. The TSA were just as bad. We travel internationally a couple of times a year and have never had to go back through screening after clearing customs and immigration. Maybe rules have changed, but the TSA was overwhelmed. It was kind of sad actually. Dozens and dozens of passengers from any airline coming through on 2/20 in the evening, missed their connections due to poorly trained and poorly supervised personnel. If you don't have at least a four hour cushion to make your connection you won't make it. Just imagine what it will be like when the airports get really busy. Use Charlotte instead.

American Airlines continues to disappoint, as does the Miami airport. Flight from Barbados arrived 100% on time, and was even acknowledged by the gate clerk who rebooked me on standby the next morning. Connection left a number of us stranded when Miami Airport was understaffed and got our luggage to us late for transfer, and couldn’t get us through the line in time. I’m sleeping in the airport tonight as AA is taking no responsibility for not holding the plane and leaving us all behind. I’ve been flying for 5 decades and this may be the most disgraceful and incompetent handling of a trip I’ve ever seen.

Worst airport I have experienced in the United States and I fly about once per month. American Airlines terminal security checkpoint took 1.5 hours to get through. I have not seen lines like this since shortly after 9/11. To make matters worse, TSA and MIA employees were doing nothing to assist in keeping the lines organized or moving forward. This entire process was a free for all. Once in the gate area, there is almost no where to charge electronic devices in the gate areas besides one desk with two electrical outlets. The American Airlines customer service was terrible and had multiple gate changes. The gates in this airport can also be extremely far apart and one gate change took almost 15 minutes to walk to without an easier and accessible way to speed this up such as a walking escalator. I ordered food at Wendy’s thinking this would be the quickest possible food and gave up waiting for my food after I had been waiting for 30 minutes. Overall, I can confidently say my experience at Miami International was the worse travel experience I have had in the last two decades. I will make a conscious effort to avoid flying into or connecting through MIA if at all possible.

commentHeader: airport employees are rude and give very little information
reviewContent: This airport is a joke. It took 1.5 hours to get through security. Only 1 TSA agent checking ID and 1 belt running. Because of this we missed our flight. Had to stand in line another 1.5 hours in a “rebooking line.” What should have been a direct 3.5 hour flight turned into an all day marathon at 3 different airports. The airport employees are rude and give very little information. That was my first and last time I will ever use Miami International.

commentHeader: With Covid 19 cleanliness should be a priority - here it is not!
reviewContent: American service is definitely not what it used to be. This airport is filthy - the departures lounges treated in such a bad way with rubbish such as pizza boxes left on seating, left on the floor - left everywhere. I can’t believe what I am seeing, such a disgrace. With Covid 19 cleanliness should be a priority - here it is not!

commentHeader: A really horrid, unnecessarily stressful, disorganised experience
reviewContent: This place is the gateway to hell. I am totally mortified at the service of this "Great Nation", it's attitude towards its visitors is shocking. We were only there for a connecting flight which the rude and extremely unhelpful staff made us miss. Disorganised, over priced, dirty. Apart from the guy that helped us after we missed our connecting flight which there was absolutely no time for due to the queues at passport control and then back in through security check. There were no signs showing where to go for connecting flights. We found the connection flight queue eventually after being stuffed in a huge snake like queue, packed in like sardines. At one point, a guy started letting all the US Nationals through to get their queue down and they took preference over the connecting flights. We only had 35 mins to board by this point. Needless to say flight missed. One horrid woman was so nasty to me when we missed our flight (which I sprinted through the airport to get to) I was stunned. A really horrid, unnecessarily stressful, disorganised experience. Never again! I give minus points. I do not recommend.

commentHeader: the worst airport I’ve flown through
reviewContent: Miami airport is by far the worst airport I’ve flown through and I’ve had to fly through it several times. Going through customs is always a mess, with long wait times for bags, disorganized rechecking of baggage, and then subsequent security checks that make you almost miss your connecting flights. The lines are always long, the TSA agents are so disrespectful, rude, and separate families who should be together all with TSA pre check. It is always a crapshoot knowing what rules and regulations they are going to enforce and then be rude to you about when you either do the maximum expected protocols, or don’t because the list literally says you don’t have to (take your shoes off, take your belt off or wallet out with an expedited screening.) Such a mess and I feel like I am literally in a foreign country. No staff speaks English to you, they all start out in Spanish and expect you to talk to them in Spanish. If you can steer clear of this airport at all, I would!

commentHeader: half the staff not wearing masks
reviewContent: Worst airport I have ever been in - filthy, rude staff in most departments especially going through security, no please or thank you. Herd you through as if your inhuman, will never use this airport again. Seating area is a mess everywhere, toilets also filthy, half the staff not wearing masks.

commentHeader: Avoid the G gates for departures at MIA at all costs
reviewContent: Avoid the G gates for departures at MIA at all costs. The security line on a Sunday morning was over an hour and a half long, and literally snaked through the terminal. As of the time of this review, the following airlines use the G gates: Bahamasair, Southwest, Sun Country, and United Airlines. There is only one TSA checkpoint that serves this concourse, zero signs for TSA PreCheck, and clueless employees attempting to organize the chaos. Additionally, the contracted employees that work at the airport (working for a third-party employer rather than actual airline employees) are absolutely miserable, and treat customers like they're an inconvenience. I think the larger D gates at the airport offer a better experience as there are four TSA entry points. The G gates, with minimal seating, an air conditioner that barely works, and next to nothing for food options, are a nightmare.

commentHeader: shambles of an immigration service at Miami airport
reviewContent: Can you score a negative? Absolute shambles of an immigration service at Miami airport. When I first arrived, I thought long queue, yes, but 40 terminals, this shouldn't be too bad. I noticed were were moving fairly slowly and then, as I first glimpsed it, the horror hit. For us 'non-citizens' only 27 terminals were available, doesn't sound too bad still however there were only 2 (two - I have to put it in brackets as it is barely believable), officers on duty for us So for the 3 flights of majority 'non-citizens' that had recently arrived (my approximation at least 400) we were being served by 2 officers. Well as you can imagine, considering they like to ask an awful lot of questions and take photos and fingerprints and all of that, it took an awful long time (4hrs by my count). Didn't even get a stamp in my passport (because of COVID) alright for people to stand in close proximity to each other for 4hrs though! First impressions of the 'greatest country in the world'- not so great.

Absolutely terrible airport. Waited at customs for 45 minutes, they were severely understaffed and were closing lines despite the growing crowds that were about to miss their flights. We then had to get our luggage from baggage claim at the other end? We then had to go check our bags in again? (Why couldn’t they just transport our bags like a typical airport?) Next, we waited at TSA for so so long. We were told to move to different lines 3 times, each at different locations. The TSA staff was insanely rude, despite letting them know (nicely) we were about to miss our connecting flight. We then had to run across the entire airport to almost miss our flight. Terrible experience.

commentHeader: rude at check in and getting through TSA
reviewContent: Employees are rude at check in and getting through TSA. The selection of beverages at restaurants and shopping locations is extremely limited. The gate has never remained the same as when booking or arriving the handful of times I have used this airport. I try to eat close to the gate I will be boarding at but with the 3-5 changes per-flight it is next to impossible.

I have never traveled through an airport that is so disorganized. If you want to wait 65+ minutes for your bags, this is the place. Workers must be playing tic tac toe on your bags while they make you wait.

This airport has really fallen far since I was last here. So dirty and unorganized, I feel like I just stepped into a third world country. I will 100% never fly through Miami international again. Ft. Lauderdale may be smaller, but this is terrible. Everyone was so rude to us, being here feels like some kind of elaborate joke. So miserable.

commentHeader: Worst airport I have ever been in
reviewContent: Worst airport I have ever been in. Seating at the gates is practically non-existent, TSA agents are rude and slow, baggage took 40 minutes to carousel. Restrooms were awful, like a dirty mall bathroom. The Eighties called, they want their airport back.

commentHeader: I will not travel through there again
reviewContent: This July my wife and I were on our way to Panama for holiday and flew from Dammam to Frankfurt to Miami in order to get connections to Panama City. We had been through two different airports on two different continents, for me to arrive for a transfer in my home country. Only in the US was I treated horribly. It started with the Global Entry "staff". The man at the desk that verifies the receipt from the kiosk was rude to everyone we saw him interact with, including a man traveling with his young daughter. He yelled at this man for not clearing his child through Global Entry. Next we got to experience collecting our bags for the international transfer. There was no person working in the baggage claim area to answer any questions, such as if we had to do the transfer ourselves. Next we had to check in to Copa Airlines. Rudest airline I have ever dealt with in my travels. Then 34 USD for a beer and small Moscow Mule. Overall the experience in Miami was the low point of our trip. I will not travel through there again. I recommend you avoid the place like the COVID-19.
Impatient, rude, short, uniformed staff! Talked to 4 different staff members and all had an attitude, security was unorganized and no one could inform me in which direction to go.

commentHeader: Nobody was policing the wearing of masks
reviewContent: Airport was very poorly managed. The TSA staff at baggage security were a shambles. No signs or instructions. The duty manager sat behind his desk and was on his phone on Facebook! The Business lounge was the dirtiest I've ever been in. Nobody was policing the wearing of masks. This with the lack of cleanliness during a worldwide pandemic is unforgivable.

We arrived at Miami International Airport at 7.23 pm from Chicago on June 29/2021, AA flight 971. Two hours later our luggage’s have not even been uploaded into the baggage carrousel, and the airport just said that the ramp has to be closed due to weather. Other flights they arrived much later have already pick up their luggage. This is Florida, an airport of this magnitude should be prepared for rain and heavier weather conditions. This is unacceptable. Very poor customer service. Shame we are forced to fly to this airport.

commentHeader: people were trying to get food and there was limited available
reviewContent: It took nearly 45 min to get through security and then we wanted to sit down and enjoy a meal and most places were closed at 4.45 pm. The airport was packed and people were trying to get food and there was limited available. With this many people in the airport places need to be open and open past 4. Unbelievable.

commentHeader: Won’t fly here again unless absolutely necessary
reviewContent: This is the worst airport I have ever experienced! A 20 minute walk (7,000 steps!) to the train that goes to the rental car center after you get all of your luggage! Concourse G has very little food, beverages or gift outlets. One charging pole with 4 outlets per gate! This is unacceptable to today’s traveller! It’s dark, old and badly needs updates into this century (21 years late!) with the amount of tourism money passing through it would seem logical to use some at MIA! Won’t fly here again unless absolutely necessary.

commentHeader: this is no way to treat a customer
reviewContent: Today is Saturday April 24th, 1.15pm. I am on the 1st floor E International Arrivals. All information kiosks are closed. There is a woman in uniform sitting at a desk. Clearly works at the airport. I tried to ask her for directions where people from Cayman Airways come out from. She screamed at me to get away if I can’t read signs. I was standing under a do not enter sign attempting to talk to her. All she would do is yell at me in a different language I could not understand. It’s this kind of attitude that I as a business owner would not tolerate. Maybe she was watching something important on her phone and I interrupted her. Who knows but this is no way to treat a customer.

commentHeader: MIA is incapable of doing security now
reviewContent: MIA is incapable of doing security now. Never have I ever experienced any 1 security line with more than 4 checkpoints at each terminal. On top of this with covid travel numbers. Security doesn't care if you miss flight and they actively laugh at you while living through high stress and anxiety. They have all the tools to make it run smoothly, they have unprofessional and sloth moving people. Covid has created an apathy to get people to work. How are we supposed to get back to work if no one actually wants to do their job. Not once was a supervisor present to get things moving. I also checked the security wait times online in the MIA airport and they were completely inaccurate. My estimated time online was 9 min, at airport it was 12, and then the actually amount of time to get through security was 50 min!

commentHeader: Not enough staff for the demand of clients
reviewContent: The security lines are poorly organized. Not enough staff for the demand of clients, only 4 officials were designated for us citizens, out of 24 cabins only 4 operating. Missed my connecting flight. No one cared, no connecting officials designated to connecting flights what a shame! Wonder if the governor knows where his money is assigned to.

Although airport is airy and modern, it’s plagued with the same issues at all US airports slow security lines and long walks from security to terminals, the biggest problem is from when you drop off your car to the security line is between 15-25 minutes depending on the gate, lots of walking, escalators, tram etc.

Landed home to the USA after 10 hour flight in from Europe because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Yes, I admit the stress and concerns of social distancing is high but my airport observations despite the travel tensions are true. Kudos to the information booth attendant in terminal 1. However, brace yourselves for the lax unprofessional TSA team. Only once before, serving jury duty, had I ever felt like I was being processed for incarceration - like a bad movie scene. I flew into MIA once before 11 years ago and it was bad. It's worse. I only flew in to avoid JFK but MIA is just not acceptable.

Horrible experience. 11 hours flight, then 3 hours queuing to an unpolite policeman. Children and ald people in the same queue. Lost our driver, who was not able to wait more than 1 hour. Something which does not happen at least in Northern Europe, UK or Middle Europe.

Horrific experience at Miami airport. Massive lineups at customs and immigration. Then had to go through security to transit. Took 2 hours. Very poorly organised. If u ever feel like a cattle experience Miami where to come and experience it!

This airport has the worst international transfer set up I have ever experienced. After waiting in lines for about 40 minutes to get through customs, you have to literally exit the airport. There is no signage for connection flights, you just have to go the baggage claim. From baggage claim you have to collect your checked baggage. Again no signage. You then have to go completely back through security. Anything you bought at your last airport, duty free, any liquids will be thrown out.
